Looks good.- Hear about Frankie?- Yeah.- You going to the funeral?- No, I'm not going.Everybody knows,sting someone, you die.Don't waste it on a squirrel.Such a hothead.I guess he could havejust gotten out of the way.I love this incorporatingan amusement park into our day.That's why we don't need vacations.Boy, quite a bit of pomp…under the circumstances.- Well, Adam, today we are men.- We are!- Bee-men.- Amen!Hallelujah!Students, faculty, distinguished bees,please welcome Dean Buzzwell.Welcome, New Hive Oitygraduating class of……9:15.That concludes our ceremonies.And begins your careerat Honex Industries!Will we pick ourjob today?I heard it's just orientation.Heads up! Here we go.Keep your hands and antennasinside the tram at all times.- Wonder what it'll be like?- A little scary.Welcome to Honex,a division of Honescoand a part of the Hexagon Group.This is it!Wow.Wow.We know that you, as a bee,have worked your whole lifeto get to the point where youcan work for your whole life.Honey begins when our valiant PollenJocks bring the nectar to the hive.Our top-secret formulais automatically color-corrected,scent-adjusted and bubble-contouredinto this soothing sweet syrupwith its distinctivegolden glow you know as…Honey!- That girl was hot.- She's my cousin!- She is?- Yes, we're all cousins.- Right. You're right.- At Honex, we constantly striveto improve every aspectof bee existence.These bees are stress-testinga new helmet technology.- What do you think he makes?- Not enough.Here we have our latest advancement,the Krelman.- What does that do?- Oatches that little strand of honeythat hangs after you pour it.Saves us millions.Oan anyone work on the Krelman?Of course. Most bee jobs aresmall ones. But bees knowthat every small job,if it's done well, means a lot.But choose carefullybecause you'll stay in the jobyou pick for the rest of your life.The same job the rest of your life?I didn't know that.What's the difference?You'll be happy to know that bees,as a species, haven't had one day offin 27 million years.So you'll just work us to death?We'll sure try.Wow! That blew my mind!“What's the difference?”How can you say that?One job forever?That's an insane choice to have to make.I'm relieved. Now we only haveto make one decision in life.But, Adam, how could theynever have told us that?Why would you question anything?We're bees.We're the most perfectlyfunctioning society on Earth.You ever think maybe thingswork a little too well here?Like what? Give me one example.I don't know. But you knowwhat I'm talking about.Please clear the gate.Royal Nectar Force on approach.Wait a second. Oheck it out.- Hey, those are Pollen Jocks!- Wow.I've never seen them this close.They know what it's likeoutside the hive.Yeah, but some don't come back.- Hey, Jocks!- Hi, Jocks!You guys did great!You're monsters!You're sky freaks! I love it! I love it!- I wonder where they were.- I don't know.Their day's not planned.Outside the hive, flying who knowswhere, doing who knows what.You can'tjust decide to be a PollenJock. You have to be bred for that.Right.Look. That's more pollenthan you and I will see in a lifetime.It's just a status symbol.Bees make too much of it.Perhaps. Unless you're wearing itand the ladies see you wearing it.Those ladies?Aren't they our cousins too?Distant. Distant.Look at these two.- Oouple of Hive Harrys.- Let's have fun with them.It must be dangerousbeing a Pollen Jock.Yeah. Once a bear pinned meagainst a mushroom!He had a paw on my throat,and with the other, he was slapping me!- Oh, my!- I never thought I'd knock him out.What were you doing during this?Trying to alert the authorities.I can autograph that.A little gusty out there today,wasn't it, comrades?Yeah. Gusty.We're hitting a sunflower patchsix miles from here tomorrow.- Six miles, huh?- Barry!A puddle jump for us,but maybe you're not up for it.- Maybe I am.- You are not!We're going 0900 at J-Gate.What do you think, buzzy-boy?Are you bee enough?I might be. It all dependson what 0900 means.Hey, Honex!Dad, you surprised me.You decide what you're interested in?- Well, there's a lot of choices.- But you only get one.Do you ever get boreddoing the same job every day?Son, let me tell you about stirring.You grab that stick, and you justmove it around, and you stir it around.You get yourself into a rhythm.It's a beautiful thing.You know, Dad,the more I think about it,maybe the honey fieldjust isn't right for me.You were thinking of what,making balloon animals?That's a bad jobfor a guy with a stinger.Janet, your son's not surehe wants to go into honey!- Barry, you are so funny sometimes.- I'm not trying to be funny.You're not funny! You're goinginto honey. Our son, the stirrer!- You're gonna be a stirrer?- No one's listening to me!Wait till you see the sticks I have.I could say anything right now.I'm gonna get an ant tattoo!Let's open some honey and celebrate!Maybe I'll pierce my thorax.Shave my antennae.Shack up with a grasshopper. Geta gold tooth and call everybody “dawg”!I'm so proud.- We're starting work today!- Today's the day.Oome on! All the good jobswill be gone.Yeah, right.Pollen counting, stunt bee, pouring,stirrer, front desk, hair removal…- Is it still available?- Hang on. Two left!One of them's yours! Oongratulations!Step to the side.- What'd you get?- Picking crud out. Stellar!Wow!Oouple of newbies?Yes, sir! Our first day! We are ready!Make your choice.- You want to go first?- No, you go.Oh, my. What's available?Restroom attendant's open,not for the reason you think.- Any chance of getting the Krelman?- Sure, you're on.I'm sorry, the Krelman just closed out.Wax monkey's always open.The Krelman opened up again.What happened?A bee died. Makes an opening. See?He's dead. Another dead one.Deady. Deadified. Two more dead.Dead from the neck up.Dead from the neck down. That's life!Oh, this is so hard!

content:
Posted: February 12, 2014
												BEFORE YOU DOWNVOTE:This game is not a Minecraft clone. It's a voxel survival game, just like Minecraft. It has guns. It has better shaders and texture quality. While right now, it may not be polished since it's a direct port from the Xbox version. It's PC, which means maybe it will be possible to mod the game.  While it does have a few bugs, it's a good game.  Pros:-Good sounds and soundtrack-Guns-Good lighting-Pretty cheap for the content you get-Still being updatedCons:-720p (Direct port from Xbox, probably will be fixed(?))-Can't fly in creative mode-Can still die from fall damage in creative mode-Can be kind of dark

number of helpful: 15 of 34 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 11, 2014
												Great Game!I first played this game on XBox 360, and from there on to the PC version while it was free. Now I have it on Steam, and while so many have given this game a bad review I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoyed playing Minecraft or games like it. This game doesn't have all the things like steps, fences, buckets, and so on but its a lot of fun & a great way to waste time if you want. Have yet to play online with anyone on the PC/Steam version but its still a lot of fun.New Players,1st Stock up on logs from trees & don't worry about dyeing, but be sure to place the logs on your main bar so if you do die you don't loose them. Gather a stack which is 64.2nd Now mine at least 32/64 iron & also place them on your main bar so if you die you don't loose them either.3rd Get everything needed to make a crate, 2 doors, and a few Iron Pickaxes.Once you have these things place your crate some place near the Bedrock tower where you start & put everything in it. Now build a room around the tower & place your doors. This is the best way to start in any mode as it gives you a safe place to get away from mobs as well as to place any items in your crate/s so you don't loose them.4th Build tunnels either above or below grown as far as you like so if you die you can run back to where you were without worry of mobs killing you on your way.This is a great game! Don't listen to the haters who gave bad reviews as they obviously don't know how to play...

content:
Posted: February 10, 2015
												Took me a minute to get the hang of it!  Has a simple crafting menu that is easy to pick up on and the monsters are relentless.  Only real complaint is how the monsters will glitch thru the floor.. so always be on your guard!EDIT :Did I say glitch thru floors?  Correction, monsters will spawn out of ceiling when it is dark.  Any dark spot.  Great game, just finished getting all the achievements and I had a blast doing it.  The music makes me feel like I'm on a epic adventure, And as a gamer, I like that.  Even when you get all g'ed up.. those monsters come so hard.. and you can only take 2-3 hits so you just have to stay on your guard.I recomend it for sure.  Now that I have mastered endurance I may just start up a epic survival world.

number of helpful: 16 of 38 people (42%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 8, 2014
												Ok, there is quite a lot of hate for this game. A lot of people are looking upon the dark side of CMZ.Ignore the things people have harshly criticized this game on. Listen, I'm going to put all the weapons on the floor and you can choose if this game really is worth the price.PRO'S AND CON'S----------PRO'S> There are a decent amount of exploration to do that would keep you playing for hours> It has a decent variety of hostile creatures that you can fight> A BRILLIANT atmosphere (especially when in caves)> A good variety of weapons> Rare finds (E.g. massive alien biome)> FANTASTIC music (just listen)> The graphics make the game feel alive> TONS of biomes with unique properties> Laser swords (Lightsabers)> Explosive weaponary! (Launchers/C4/TNT)> GREAT sound effects> 8 player co-op> You don't need ANY hassle to set up a server that random people can join> Updated/Patched well (every patch helps every aspect)> Lots of different blocks/materials to find> MANY achievements to get> A good variety of gamemodes> Good goals (E,g, Undead Dragon)----------CON'S> No voice chat in multiplayer> Some glitches> More options needed> Resolution needs to be enhanced> No multiplayer modes> More content needed> Storyline required (Basic Story)> More detail in mobs> More randomly generating stuff like crash biomes> Generally more updates> No AUG :( (please add the AUG)----------OVERALLVery fun and interesting game however it lacks quite a few feautres that could easily be added.----------RATING8/10----------Thank you for reading, hopefully the developers of CastleMiner Z read too - (And add the AUG ;) )Please note: This is my personal opinion so please don't be harsh.

content:
Posted: September 30, 2014
												Review updated 2015-10-05 after hours of playing this game. Old review will be at bottom. # NEW UPDATED REVIEW (SHORT)The game has it moments, it shines most when you can get some friends online and just try surviving and creating your base underground. The game gets repetive after some hours so without friends i really dont see the point in playing further after 5-10hrs singleplayer or more. There is no random missions just mine and hide underground. Whole point seems to be to mine and craft better and better guns.Endurance mode - You will NOT stay alive for long above ground. Best is to dig underground from start and then mine the whole way to the end. You cant save in this mode so count many hrs for this. Survival mode - Is fun for a couple of hours but as said earlier game gets repetive with no random missions.Its not the best game but fun with friends on a lan party.GFx 6-10 (Compared to other similar mine games)SFx 5-10Gameplay 7-10Enjoy. I still recommend it as i did have fun. Mostly with friends.# OLD REVIEW!Loads of fun with this minecraft clone aka not clone :) What i mean is that it reminds of minecraft but its more oriented with crafting guns to defeat your foes than just a sandbox.I have fun trying to find items such as copper, iron, gold, diamonds and more stuff i havent found yet. Building and mining is as fun as it was in minecraft but crafting is alot easier and more basic.Can you survive the night? How far can you get before you get hunted down? How many days can you survive? Well its up to you, so give the game a chance. i did and iam enjoying it alot as you can see on gaming hours. :)One note for developer. It wouldnt hurt to be able to create more stuff ingame. And adding som daily quests just to get some more random stuff to hunt for would be cool. And ingame medals screen how many you have completed.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												You know you're playing a terrible game when you force yourself to like it. For $3.75 ($15.00/4), this was entirely a disappointment. In fact, I should be compensated to endure such a graphically depressing, purposeless, rip-off of a Minecraft mod. That's right, it looks like some 12 year old took Minecraft (an already novelty game in of itself), drowned it, stripped it of its meat, and left it with iPhone-level selections of bricks, ores, and wood. If Minecraft and DayZ had a son whose set of chromosomes are of abundant numbers, this would be the incinerated fecal matter that arose out of it's rectal orifice.However, 10/10 would recommend sending this as a prank gift.

content:
Posted: February 9, 2014
												An amazing game that I've followed and played since it's early Xbox Live Indie Game years. It's great fun to play with friends, it's basically but not exactly like Minecraft, with a hint of an Endless Wave survival of enemies. Which mainly include Zombies, Skeletons, and Dragons. (Yes, I know this also sounds vaguely familiar, but hear me out.) You're not going through this world with dinky little swords and bows. You get GUNS, bro! Rifles, Assult Rifle, Pistols, Shotguns, SMGs, and much more as you battle to survive or just get your resources to make a shelter. It's quite a fun experience, though it'll take some time getting used to as your tools can break while you're using them on trees, and rocks, and so. So most likely you're going to need to carry spares of that pickaxe before you try and mine that ore. But that's just a minor setback for all of the fun experiences to be had! Great game, great creators that listen to suggestions! Overall fun game. (Note: You're obviously going to need a slightly higher end pc to get some decent graphics or framerates.)

content:
Posted: November 5, 2014
												I know this game receives a LOT of hate, but I generally like the game. It was ported from the Xbox 360 onto here. I had bought it on the Xbox with a few of my friends before Minecraft: 360 Edition came out, and I honestly spent hours and hours in this game. This is a type of time wasting game that I quite enjoy, and since I bought it when it was on sale, I didn't have to spend much to get a few hours of memories back. All of the players I have met so far online have been very friendly and cooperative. What made this game so special on the 360, is that it used your avatar in place as your character. The soldier characters are kind of wierd, but I don't mind them much. There are many things I actually really, really like about Castleminer Z. The variety of weapons, actually having to make bullet casings and then bullets, the biomes (especially when you start to get out at least 5k blocks), the dragons (May be hard to kill at first, but craft an LMG, makes it a lot easier, and loot is generally worth it), and that there is a Hell. That is found really interesting, seeing that not other games are like that at all. Sure the game may not be for a lot of people or what a lot of people expect, but it still has many positive atributes. I bought this game mainly to complete all the achievements, and I will play the game even after I have finished doing that.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2015
												UhNot too sure what to write here so heres a recipe for Pancakes insteadIngredients:1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour3 tablespoons sugar1 tablespoon baking powder1/4 teaspoon salt1/8 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg2 large eggs, at room temperature1 1/4 cups milk, at room temperature1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract3 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more as neededNow to make it1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg.2. In another bowl, beat the eggs and then whisk in the milk and vanilla.3. Melt the butter in a large cast iron skillet or griddle over medium heat.4. Whisk the butter into the milk mixture. Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture, and whisk until a thick batter is just formed5. Keeping the skillet at medium heat, ladle about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet, to make a pancake. Make 1 or 2 more pancakes, taking care to keep them evenly spaced apart. Cook, until bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, and the undersides are golden brown, about 2 minutes. Flip with a spatula and cook about 1 minute more on the second side. Serve immediately or transfer to a platter and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more butter to the skillet as needed.6. Procedure for adding fruit to pancakes: Once the bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, scatter the surface with sliced or diced fruit, or chocolate chips, nuts, etc. Flip with a spatula and cook for 1 minute more, being careful not to burn toppings.

content:
Posted: October 26, 2014
												First Impressions:This isn't the most in-depth or stable open-world builder I've ever played, but there's multiple game modes and multiplayer available making five bucks a small price to pay for potentially many hours of playtime.  Crafting is fairly easy, though tool-tips would have admittedly been nice.  Customizing keybinds partially works, but the defaults still activate when in the crafting menu (Q still throws an item in your inventory, even if throwing is bound to another key).  Still, it does more right then wrong.

number of helpful: 7 of 27 people (26%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 1, 2014
												Castleminer Z is a game we all know, it just has a different skin.I've played this game for 200 hours+ on Xbox 360, don't let my play time fool you. This is easily one of my top 10 games I have ever played. Why you ask? Well let me explain it to you.Castleminer Z is a game where you collect resources, craft weapons, and fight hordes of zombies, spooky skeletons, dragons, aliens, and even Satan himself. Not only can you fight, but you can also build forts, and travel vast distances that will can make your friends wonder why you play this game so much.  This game can challenge you, and make you feel proud that you got that far and killed that ice dragon.  This is al well and good, but lets take a look at some real ups and downs.The Pros-   Fun sandbox gameplay   Familiar FPS feel   Co-op   PVE/PVP   Building   Ranged/Melee combat   Good difficulty scale that can make you stop and rethink your plan/strategy   $5 is a good price point The Cons-   Performance is mediocre   Not many graphical options, but some coming soon   Sensitivity   Game can feel boring without friends (opinion)   Boring, recycled textures from another game (Castleminer, only on Xbox 360)   Zombie hording can massively overwhelm and kill you almost instantly   Was a game that went with the trend of voxel graphics   PVP is there, but not very exciting (may add more if i come up with stuff)All and all, Castleminer Z is a pretty good game. I could recommend it to anyone who is a fan of Minecraft and likes survival zombie games. $5 is a good price point for this product, and a sale rolls around every now and then. If you can, get some friends to pick up the game or buy a four pack to play together. If you want to know more about this game, search it on youtube, there are plenty of videos on it from 2 years ago when this game was the♥♥♥♥♥♥on Xbox 360.

content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

number of helpful: 10 of 89 people (11%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 6, 2014
												1. It does indeed smell of Minecraft™2. True, it does lack option in the way of PC end-user preference3. And also, I agree that the world feels kinda empty; events arent varrying enough quite yet even after a little playthroughBut, I've read on the steam forums for this game a post concerning the need for updating, considering the game's current instance. The OP asked, "Will there be additional updates?" followed by the sub-statement, "they are still updating and fixing this game right?".Then the dev responds, "Yes, we are still working on the game." Very (hopefully) relieving words, as this game has a lot of potential. Hardly anyone is a stranger to the zombie interjection taking up gaming as of late, but a voxel based zombie game sounds interesting enough. And it's nice to see some level of competition against the (personally) overpriced 7 Days to Die™ (in it's current state). But all of those things aside,4. It does control smoothly5. Crafting system is adequate and carries itself so-so6. Exploration is actually interesting (to me)7. I have not noticed any graphical issues on high (yet)It seems that somewhere, while checking into the game deciding whether to buy it or not, I had read a response from the developer that they intend to close the gap on issues such as missing chat features and such. Another poster in the forum that I originally mentioned had the great idea of opening this game up to the Steam Workshop, an idea I believe will be a saving grace for the game's replayablity, just like all games that go that route.In short, it does need work...but I personally sense potential in this game, and since the devs say it is work in progress, I think it will be a worthwhile purchase, especially if you love voxel games and/or zombie games.:::::::ONE DEFINITE THING TO MENTION TO THE DEV/DEVS:::::::                         If this is in a beta-form, like I have read in various (cant remember where at the moment) then it would be most helpful to mention this in the 'store page' of the game. If it's in there somewhere and I missed it, sorry, nvm.

content:
Posted: February 4, 2014
												I've followed this game since it's first day on Xbox Indie, and it seemed to a lot of people, just a minecraft clone. Which at the time, it more or less was. CastleMiner, a creative game that let you play with a few hundred blocks and let you unlock newer blocks by placing, more rocks. Then a few months, probably after CastleMiners success, this game bubbled up and I whipped that♥♥♥♥♥♥up as fast as I could. The first thing I may have noticed was that the sounds were a bit poop, but eh, the guns had bullet drop. I played it for about a month straight, making trenches across the whole map and using them as halfway bases. I essentially stopped playing the game after coming over to PC, and played it now and again. And boy was I glad when I logged into Steam to see this in New Releases.You've got four modes that you can play in this, they are described in the description, I have never even tried to unlock the Dragon mode, it seemed too hard, but I have gotten hours of fun out of it, and for $10 I think that's a good deal.

number of helpful: 32 of 181 people (18%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 3, 2014
												There is a lot I can say about this game, with probably around 200+ hours played on the Xbox I am here to say this game is really amazing. Yes, the port has been pretty much taken directly from the Xbox but it's a work in progress but even then, it still plays real well on the PC. To the gameplay/features, if you enjoy building your own forts, castles or whatever then defending it against mobs of zombies, skeletons, dragons, demons, and aliens then this game is for you. It has quite the range of weapons such as normal shotguns and pistols to laser guns to rocket launchers and even light sabers. Then the landscapes/biomes I really enjoy a lot (Biomes are the forest, vertigo forest, desert, mountains, tundra, the desent, alien crash site and of course, Hell!) the world is HUGE. The further you head out into the world, the harder it is to survive. If you can reach distance 4,000, you will be able to fight the undead dragon which I always thought was pretty fun to do especially with friends.The game isn't perfect by all means and one thing I will take away from the game is the lack of variety of blocks as compared to the first Castleminer which has a very large variety to choose from, I hope to see some of them return in the future in Castleminer Z. Ignore the people who claim this game is just a Minecraft clone just because you can build things with blocks, block building does not mean it's a ripoff. If that was the case then every FPS would be a ripoff of past FPS games.But, this game has evolved so much since the day it released on Xbox, many amazing features have been added and even more to come. I for one am really looking forward to those.

number of helpful: 36 of 270 people (13%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 3, 2014
												CastleMiner Z - Indie Game ReviewOriginality -Many people have been saying this game is a knock off of minecraft. I can see how you would get that but the truth of the matter is it isnt. CMZ takes place in a block based enviorment. That is the only thing the two games have in common. That is the only link between the two games. And now I know someone is gonna send me a private messege saying "The games both have pickaxes". No♥♥♥♥♥♥ Without pickaxes the world wouldnt be where its at today. So a pickaxe is essential for anygame of this type. Overall I give the game a 8/10 for Originalty because the only thing i have seen in other games that is in this game is the terrain. Everything put into this type of game is a one of a kind. Quality - The games graphics are pretty good. Better then minecrafts 16x16. The textures in this game look like there above 186x186 pixel range. So items are pretty high quality. The character models are kind of derpy and i would recomend that we should have a character builder. Also NPC's are pretty derpy. But there hitbox is good in my opion. The game runs very smoothly even when your recording. It supports FULL CONTROLER SUPPORT which is just AWESOME!!!. Even though you were able to have that in the beta. So for quality I give a 7/10 because the character models and NPC's are very derpy and need some work. Im done talking about the game and now im going to talk about what i think the game should have.So the game is missing a few things. One is armor. Enemies kill you so fast. I think armor is a must. Steam workshop is also needed. In a game like this there is a lot of potential for modding support and great community ideas that can come to life. Last It needs BADGES, TRADING CARDS, EMOTIOCONS, AND BACKGROUNDS. I love collecting those things and I think it would help promote the game and make it more fun for users to interact with each other. Stop reading this BS and buy the game :D

content:
Posted: March 29, 2014
												CastleMiner Z is a sandbox game where you can build and survive against very dangerous monsters. Now, most people are giving this game a REALLY bad name. I just bought it today, played it for about 2 1/2 hours, and had a pretty awesome time with it. It has a lot of variety weapon wise, and plenty of monsters for you and your friends to kill, and it's just a pretty good game to pass the time. There are also a lot of really cool places to go, like Hell, or Oreland.True, sometimes it has its bugs and glitches, and there could be more building blocks in it, like in my case, I wanted some fences and glass for my mansion, but they weren't available. There aren't a lot of options for graphics, but it doesn't really seem that this game takes a whole dumptruck of RAM to run. People play this for a half hour and think "This game sucks". Well ya know what? This game came out pretty recently. It's going to update of course and they will be fixing bugs. This game gets updated quite often people! Don't let everyone make you believe a game is crap based on their experience playing it!

												definately worth the 5 bucks. ya, there may not be much, but the developer is still making updates to improve the game, and listening to fans. as it stands now, the game is decent. chatting is hard though since its very limited. in the settings, the graphicks go to loqwest to highest, orly effecting the render distance, so thats a bit annoying that i cant lower the overall graphics.      the sensitivity on mouse cant be lowered, so at first that annoyed the hell out of me, but i got an xbox cntroller, so used it. if you have been playing this on xbox and thinking the pc version is gonna be better, its absolutely not at the moment. no avatar custimization, no voice chat(unless using skype, team chat, ect.), less people playing(from my experience), and can be a bit boring sometimes. however, there is an update coming out that will fic graphics and mod support is being worked on, so the devs may turn this around.      if i knew that the pc version looked identical to the xbox version, to be honest, i would have just saved my money. however, if you dont have an xbox and you are willing to forgive its lack of custamizationin both the player models and settings, then you will not be dissapointed. since its a minecraft inspired game, you can build a base, house, or whatever, and still defent yourself against the zombie outbreak to see how long you can last.      i give this game a 5/10. i love the game, but as it stands, its an average game. with future updates, and new content, i see this game being a 6 or 7 out of 10. but if u have xbox and connected to the internet, please buy it there. same game basically, and mabye even better on the xbox depending on how well your pc can handle games.

content:
Posted: September 7, 2015
												A very enjoyable game. Similar to Minecraft in many ways, Castle Miner Z looks so much better and is actually a game with aggressive and deadly enemies, rather than the 'cutesy' Lego simulator that is Minecraft. It may have less of a range of building blocks, but the endless fun both overground and below the surface makes for addictive gameplay. A good, fun, and addictive action game that looks great and plays well.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 8, 2015
												I had fun with this back on Xbox, but the game is bad. The textures are bad, the physics are easily the worst part of the game. And worst of all, it has been abandoned by the developer, it hasn't been updated in over a year and no word since. There is no direction to CastleMiner Z. I get what they are trying to do, but it doesn't work, because there isn't really a whole lot to do. Ok you have the best weapons and a really awful looking house of bloodstone. Now what? Shoot zombies? I mean, there's nothing to do. You could say "why not just build♥♥♥♥♥♥" because building isn't fun in CastleMiner Z. There is no water, Building blocks are extremely limited, There is no animals to breed, no exp to farm only 1 boss to fight, and there isn't much you get from killing it. The game is empty. Oh and there's no fov slider so if you like high fov, you're♥♥♥♥♥♥out of luck. It used to be my favorite indie game on Xbox, but TBH I give it a 4/10 Underaverage. If you want a Minecraft Indie spin-off, go grab Total Miner: Forge when it releases on steam... If it ever does. Or get it on the 360 now, They are still updating and it's turning into an RPG which I am quite fond of.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2015
												I enjoy these types of games - but I dislike the lack of content it currently contains.I would say this game has good potential - and I feel in time it may become interesting.I am pleased that development for updates has resumed with a new team in place!Features I would like to see are as followed:Some more items like armor, maybe some more tech, more blocks for building, etc.Im pretty happy with the weapons, more would be cool though.I'd like to see more creative mode features - like actual invincibility, a full item inventory to acquire items.I think flight could be a cool thing aswell - maybe some craftable dragon wings or something like that.A campaign for survival - a horde mode perhaps, and a tutorial for beginners would bring more variation.I will give this a recommendation - although my current voting for this game would be to wait for more features.If you like simplicity then this game is probably down your alley.

content:
Posted: April 21, 2015
 KEEP TO MINECRAFT, AVOID THIS GAMEI am a very open minded person and I like most games, but this game........ this game is extremely unpleasant to play, I have owned this game on Xbox 360 and assumed that this would be just as good, but I was wrong. I am aware that I have only played this for under 10 minutes for me to conclude that this game is beyond horrible, I dont have much developing experience in games, but it looks like this game was developed on a computer with no monitor.There is barely anything to do in this game, and it insults alot of minecraft fans with this attempt of a Minectaft-style FPS. If you want a minecraft-style FPS, I am sure there are mods or modpacks like the verious platforms; Fead the beast and Tekkit, to have the same gun theme as this, but with the safety that it is FREE, stable, and still keeps to the base of MInecraft. There are also so many texturepacks that you could obtain on the minecraft forums and websites. All i am saying is keep to Minecaft and forget this ugly attempt of a game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 20, 2015
												This is a pretty nice game and I've enjoyed playing it with friends. Most stuff is like Minecraft, but sort of playable in a way that feels vastly different to minecraft, and is really fun. There's a few bits and bobs here and there that need patching up, and it could use a lot more content, armour, requirements other than materials for better things, more things to spend resources on once you reach end game, and stuff like that. But overall, its pretty fun.Multiplayer is even better to play, as you can go around mining, killing dragons, raiding those floating space things for resources to make space guns, and stuff like that with friends. Basically, it's just awesome to play with friends. Although I played a bit of this game with friends for a while, it took me 20 hours of gameplay and looking around on the wiki as well to figure out where all of the server stuff is such as kick players, making it private, and putting passwords on. So for a good 15 hours or so we were paranoid about randoms coming and joining, then stealing all of our stuff. This happened quite commonly.Anyways, the game is really fun in singleplayer and multiplayer, and I actually like it as much or more than Minecraft. Graphics are alright (what you'd expect from a block game like this), gameplay is pretty fun, but the only thing that could be worked on that I've noticed is the amount of content in the game, as at the moment there's a limited amount of blocks, and outside weapons and tools, there is next to nothing to craft.So, all in all, I rate it 8/10ALSO, to anybody who hasn't found the server stuff yet and wants to play with friends, you press escape, and then go into options, then Host Options at the top. From there you can kick players that are a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥and also make the game private and stuff like that.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 7, 2015
												This is, as there are many now, a miner-style game. However, this is one of the better ones. This game not only has the general fun, pvp, and free-sandbox style of feel to it, but it adds a 'defensive' sense to it, whereas you are not safe during the day or at any time really. I've played this game for countless hours on my Xbox 360 and now have purchased it on Steam, so this review encompasses both games. This game adds the sense to a mining-sandbox game like no other in the concept that there are constantly hostiles (zombies, skeletons, and even flying dragons!). You must always be on the lookout for monsters outside of your fortification, and more often than not, be cautious inside as well! At first I figured this game would be cheap in quality in comparison to the price, however it clearly surpasses the price in quality. There are many weapons to choose from and different qualities. The main flaw I have with this game is that there aren't many 'creative' items to build. Besides your standard tools, you can only build doors, torches, and walls. I would like to see more items, however this is still worth the $1.99!Pros--Sandbox game-Mining game-Always monsters-Adds a 'defensive' spin to the game (always makes me feel as though I need to construct an elaborate bunker)-Cheap in price ($1.99 is definitely worth it, I'd be willing to pay up to $15-20 for it)-Automatic climbing (you don't have to spacebar every block, you can actually just move forward and move up blocks)Cons--Would like to see some feature to increase the sunshine when in daylight, always cloudy to some annoyance-Not meant for creative minds, very few blocks to build with other than walls-Seems to be a game you play at first for a few hours, stop and forget for a few days, then remember and play again

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 25, 2015
												I got this game gifted to me and just laughed and figured it would be horrible, just by looking at the picture. But then 4 hours of playing later, it's actually a really fun game. Yeah the graphics aren't the best, but the shear insanity of the game makes up for it. Going to each biome and fighting the biome-based dragons is one of the best things about it, they get harder the farther you travel, and you get decent loot from them too! Another thing that makes this game great for the price that it is, is the fact that you're never really safe. Whether you're mining in a cave, or you're outside wandering the biomes. There's always going to be messed up looking aliens, zombies, and skeletons shooting their arrows at you from a far. Also the fact that in caves they just magically fall from above you and land on your head is terrifyingly great, you never expect it and it scares you every time, sending you into a panic and firing an obseen amount of bullets into their faces....mind you that is really satisfying. Also the variety of weapons that you can get is awesome, nothing beats pulling out an AK and completly destroying mobs. To sum it all up, in my opinion this game is 100% worth $2. I would still buy it even if it was more that $2. So buy yourself a copy and get ready to have some fun.

content:
Posted: May 2, 2014
												definately worth the 5 bucks. ya, there may not be much, but the developer is still making updates to improve the game, and listening to fans. as it stands now, the game is decent. chatting is hard though since its very limited. in the settings, the graphicks go to loqwest to highest, orly effecting the render distance, so thats a bit annoying that i cant lower the overall graphics.      the sensitivity on mouse cant be lowered, so at first that annoyed the hell out of me, but i got an xbox cntroller, so used it. if you have been playing this on xbox and thinking the pc version is gonna be better, its absolutely not at the moment. no avatar custimization, no voice chat(unless using skype, team chat, ect.), less people playing(from my experience), and can be a bit boring sometimes. however, there is an update coming out that will fic graphics and mod support is being worked on, so the devs may turn this around.      if i knew that the pc version looked identical to the xbox version, to be honest, i would have just saved my money. however, if you dont have an xbox and you are willing to forgive its lack of custamizationin both the player models and settings, then you will not be dissapointed. since its a minecraft inspired game, you can build a base, house, or whatever, and still defent yourself against the zombie outbreak to see how long you can last.      i give this game a 5/10. i love the game, but as it stands, its an average game. with future updates, and new content, i see this game being a 6 or 7 out of 10. but if u have xbox and connected to the internet, please buy it there. same game basically, and mabye even better on the xbox depending on how well your pc can handle games.

content:
Posted: May 16, 2015
												Oh man what do i have to say about castleminerz, Well a very very good game and here is why: How to progress in this game is not as complex as you may think nor is it too easy it is a sort of moderate difficulty, but of course you can change from starting with a pistol, knife, 200  bullets , and a stone pickaxe + compass To COMPLETELY NOTHING (hardcore mode ) As they say, real men play hardcore!                      Hardcore vs  EasyHardcore is for real menEasy is way too easy no enemies difficulty is for people with no conscious mindHardcore is more challenging Hardcore Actually increases The total playtime to complete every single thing you possibly can And i mean everything (so basically a 1.99 $ game is now worth like 10$)On easy there are like 8 enemies per night (Have played 22hrs or something like that so i know this stuff)In hardcore enemies are more tough adding up to to them almost killing you every time wich is a good/bad thing :/And one of the best parts:DRAGONS! Oh mai gawd the dragons are awesome  Each one giving you different loot, So for example if you kill the same dragon like 200000000003489334754849 times after like 50000 You may only get a copper bar  Because the game can sense if you have killed it and it is too easy, so sometimes it may be nothing at all! I love this because it adds more sense of exploring to the game, so if you enter a different biome, the main element that biome is made out of, That elemental dragon will appear! <3 <3 <3 And There is another thing, Aliens! The toughest enemy in the game! Out of all the laser tools and weapons i have made, not once have i defeated an alien with ease. And you also have to explore to about 800max blocks in a certain direction (randomized) To see the crash site of an alien ship. More exploring Mah favourite! And + THERE ARE WEAPONS LIKE GUNS NOT JUST SWORD AND BOW LIKE MINECRAFT This game honestly, to me makes minecraft look like a total fail (not toally but partial) So ther are: Diamond guns gold guns bloodstone guns conventional guns (normal ) And different types of bullets too! This is amazingly cool         END                                                          OF                                        REVIEW

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 28, 2016
												In conclusion, let's just say that this game is playable, but maybe not for too long.Bought this game on a sale, played it for a couple of hours, I think Castleminer Z is quite fun, if you have some friends to play with. Blowing mountains, digging through hell, fighting Satan, kill a bunch of aliens. You can do that, just like the other sandbox games.However, unlike the Minecraft and Terraria or some other sandboxs, you can't take this game as a building game, because there's no furniture. Yes, I said that, there's no furniture in this game. This, is the main downside of this game. And the blocks ain't that varies either. You can build a big mansion, yes, but only with total same blocks and without any tables nor chairs, only doors and torches. Oh, and there's no water.It basically take the fun out of the game real quick, for there's only few things to do. So if you wanted to buy and play this game, make sure it's on a sale, and there's a couple of friends. Play with them, that's where the fun is.

												when i first played this game it was back when XBOX live indie games were a thing, ♥♥♥♥♥♥ knock offs of really popular games and being charged a dollar to have the full game.out of all the knock offs of minecraft this one takes the cake for being a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ knock off of minecraft but with guns, more dragons, an actuall hell with demons, aliens in crashed meteors and lazer weapons (advanced warfare anyone?(this was released BEFORE advanced warfare was announced))since i lasted played this on the xbox the meteor thing happened and that was the last i heard of the game, fast forward to when i purchased this so much stuff has changed, demons are larger (at least larger than i remember) monster spawners are scattered as well as loot boxes and the menu is right ♥♥♥♥♥ to navagate.there's only one other good minecraft knock off that i played that's also an indie game but that's for another review (if it's even on steam)anyway i recommend this to anyone who wants a minecraft knock off that ain't half bad nor half good.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 29, 2014
												CastleMiner Z is a sandbox game where you can build and survive against very dangerous monsters. Now, most people are giving this game a REALLY bad name. I just bought it today, played it for about 2 1/2 hours, and had a pretty awesome time with it. It has a lot of variety weapon wise, and plenty of monsters for you and your friends to kill, and it's just a pretty good game to pass the time. There are also a lot of really cool places to go, like Hell, or Oreland.True, sometimes it has its bugs and glitches, and there could be more building blocks in it, like in my case, I wanted some fences and glass for my mansion, but they weren't available. There aren't a lot of options for graphics, but it doesn't really seem that this game takes a whole dumptruck of RAM to run. People play this for a half hour and think "This game sucks". Well ya know what? This game came out pretty recently. It's going to update of course and they will be fixing bugs. This game gets updated quite often people! Don't let everyone make you believe a game is crap based on their experience playing it!

content:
Posted: May 2, 2014
												definately worth the 5 bucks. ya, there may not be much, but the developer is still making updates to improve the game, and listening to fans. as it stands now, the game is decent. chatting is hard though since its very limited. in the settings, the graphicks go to loqwest to highest, orly effecting the render distance, so thats a bit annoying that i cant lower the overall graphics.      the sensitivity on mouse cant be lowered, so at first that annoyed the hell out of me, but i got an xbox cntroller, so used it. if you have been playing this on xbox and thinking the pc version is gonna be better, its absolutely not at the moment. no avatar custimization, no voice chat(unless using skype, team chat, ect.), less people playing(from my experience), and can be a bit boring sometimes. however, there is an update coming out that will fic graphics and mod support is being worked on, so the devs may turn this around.      if i knew that the pc version looked identical to the xbox version, to be honest, i would have just saved my money. however, if you dont have an xbox and you are willing to forgive its lack of custamizationin both the player models and settings, then you will not be dissapointed. since its a minecraft inspired game, you can build a base, house, or whatever, and still defent yourself against the zombie outbreak to see how long you can last.      i give this game a 5/10. i love the game, but as it stands, its an average game. with future updates, and new content, i see this game being a 6 or 7 out of 10. but if u have xbox and connected to the internet, please buy it there. same game basically, and mabye even better on the xbox depending on how well your pc can handle games.
